p: The perceived relevance of the listed journals regarding IS article identification ranged from 26.5 to 97.1% ( Figure 1). Overall, Implementation Science and BMC (BioMed Central) Health Services Research were perceived as relevant by 33 experts (97.1%), followed by Implementation Research and Practice ( n = 29; 85.3%) and BMJ (British Medical Journal) Quality and Safety ( n = 28; 82.4%). Two journals received relevance ratings below 50%: Clinical and Translational Science and JDR (Journal of Dental Research) Clinical and Translational Research, which was unknown to over half (55.9%) of the participants. Also, European and North American experts' perceptions varied strongly regarding three other journals: BMJ Quality and Safety (respectively, 76.5 vs. 50%), Translational Behavioral Medicine (respectively, 58.8 vs. 100%), and PLoS ONE (respectively, 47.1 vs. 68.8%) ( Figure 2).
